review_blob: 500 ml bottle from brewery. Pours a lightly cloudy orange colour with average-sized off-white head. Aroma is mostly just tart apple with a light maltiness but its not unpleasant. The tartness is really overpowering in the flavour. Average body. Not really my thing.

Growler from the brewery. Pours a quite dark brown with modest-sized light tan head. Aroma is dry roastiness, chocolate and hint of coffee. Flavour has quite a chocolatey presence, sort of semisweet with dry roasty character and light coffeeish notes as well as a hint of fruitiness. Carbonation on the gentler side. Quite nice.

On tap at Volo. Pours a very dark brown with average-sized beige head with a little lacing. Aroma is big on tart dark fruit with some wood, anise and mellow roastiness. Flavour is also quite fruity and vinuous with raisin, plum and other dark fruits, some spiciness, anise, mellow roastiness, woodiness and leather. Fine, fairly lively carbonation. Nice.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear golden colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is crisp graininess, grass and a very light fruitiness. Flavour has assertive crackery grains and grassiness with just a hint of apple-ish fruitiness. Crisp finish. Carbonation a little livelier than average. Solid.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear golden colour with smallish white head. Aroma is sweet grains with a bit of a vegetal note and light grassiness. Flavour is gently sweet graininess, hint of creamed corn and light grassiness. Meh.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a deep orange colour with small off-white head. Aroma is toasty and fruity with a little caramelly sweetness. Flavour has a more assertive fruitiness with some underlying toasty, crackery character and a bit of grassiness. Fairly quick, crisp finish. Pleasant.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden colour with lasting white head. Aroma is full of fruity yeast, lemon and herbal hoppiness. Flavour is dry and yeasty with lemon, tart apple/pear, light banana, with herbal, slightly floral hops. Lively carbonation. Subtle alcohol. Quite nice.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is citric and piney with a little biscuity malt. Flavour is orange zest, bit of lemon and some pine resin with some subtle biscuit character. Relatively lively carbonation. Nice one.

650 ml bottle from brewery. Pours a murky dull golden orange colour with lots of floaties and modest-sized off-white head. Aroma is cooked tree fruit, Belgian yeast, light spice and a sort of herbal bitterness. Flavour is fairly yeasty with baked apple/pear, clove and herbal bitterness. A bit watery. Body is a little flat/lifeless. Underwhelming.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a murky peach colour with moderate-sized white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, wheat, grapefruit zest and a little resin. Flavour is less punchy in terms of hops, but has lots of citrus with grapefruit and lemon rind, some resin and a modest wheatiness. Mellow bitterness in finish. Carbonation on the subtler side. Solid.

500 ml bottle from brewery bottle shop. Pours a cloudy pale golden straw colour with modest-sized white head. Aroma is green, citric hoppiness with some light tropical fruitiness. Flavour is leafy and citric with some effervescent lemon and lime zest. Fine, lively carbonation. Nice refreshing one.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy dull golden colour with thin head. Aroma is sweetish with banana, caramel and clove. Flavour also gently sweet with some bananaish fruitiness, some caramel and a gentle clove character. Mellow carbonation. Fine but forgettable.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a very dark brown colour with modest-sized light tan head. Aroma is modestly roasty and dry with chocolate, some coffee, a little dark fruit. Flavour is roasty and dry with a hint of sweetness, semisweet chocolate, some coffee, treacle and hints of dark, dry fruit. Average carbonation. Nice one.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear golden yellow with average white head. Aroma is sweet with straw, fruit and light graininess. Flavour is also fairly sweet with a mellow graininess, some straw and a light fruitiness. Body on the lighter side of average. Ok.

750 ml bottle from brewery bottle shop. Pours a very cloudy pale, dull yellow colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is bright, tart lime juice and lots of Brett funk. Flavour is nicely tart with lime juice and big Brett funkiness. Soft carbonation. Nice one.

500 bottle from brewery bottle shop. Pours a hazed bright straw colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is somewhat catty with solid pine resin, some lemon and some other fruitiness. Flavour is pungent resiny hops with a nice citrusy note with assorted tropical fruits. Gently bitter in the finish. Nice one.

On cask at the Oxley. Pours a rubyish brown with nice light tan head that leaves solid lace. Aroma is definite cherry with some roast and chocolate. Taste also features prominent cherry with solid roastiness and a bit of chocolate. Creamyish mouthfeel. Pleasant.

beer_brewer_name: Lake of the Woods Brewing Company
review_blob: On tap at Dukes Refresher + Bar (as "The Stranger"). Pours a very dark brown with large light tan head. Aroma is chai, vanilla, cinnamon and toasted grains. Flavour is surprisingly sweet with lots of spice - mostly chai and cinnamon - some vanilla and an underlying toasty graininess. Average-full body. Subtle carbonation. Neat one.
beer_name: Lake of the Woods X Big Rock

review_blob: On tap at Dukes Refresher + Bar. Pours a clearish orange colour with good-sized white head that leaves nice lace. Aroma is caramel, citrus and light graininess. Flavour is caramel and grainy maltiness with a solid zesty citrus hop note. Drying finish. Average plus body. Good IPA.

On tap at the Oxley. Pours a dark orangey brown with solid eggshell-coloured head. Aroma is smoked grains with solid honey and caramel sweetness. Flavour also a nice balance of sweet and smoke with deeply toasted grains and some sweet honey and caramel. Slick mouthfeel. Decent.

On tap at Bar Hop Brewco. Pours a cloudy golden colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is sweetish tree fruit, hibiscus, a little banana and some clove. Flavour is quite fruity with apple, banana and other tree fruit, along with some hibiscus and clove. Fine carbonation. Solid.

On tap at Bar Hop Brewco. Pours a murky, dull golden orange with good-sized white head with nice lacing. Aroma is caramel, grains and citric hops. Flavour is citrusy, tropical fruit hops with solid caramel and grains. Solid bitterness in finish. Nice one.

On tap at Bar Hop Brewco. Pours a clearish orange colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is quite fruity with grains and some grassiness. Flavour is tart appleish, minerals, graininess and some grassy hops. Bit of tart, dry character in the finish. Carbonation on the fine side. Decent.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a lightly hazy, deep golden colour with decent-sized, lasting white head. Aroma is both sweet and dry with lots of tree fruit, white wine character, spices and herbs. Flavour has bright, modestly sweet, modestly tart apple, pear and peach with lots of dry vinous character, some fruity/spicy yeast character and a bit of a herbal note. Medium carbonation. Interesting one.

355 ml bottle from LCBO (Part of Spring Mix Pack 2016). Pours a clear orangey amber colour with average-sized off-white head. Aroma is sweet caramel, with maple and a bit of graininess. Flavour is also sweet and big on caramel with maple on the subtler side, gently toasty grains and a bit of grassiness. Slick mouthfeel. Ok.

500 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a clear orange/copper colour modest-sized white head. Aroma is toffee, grains and some spicy herbs. Flavour is robust toffee, grains, bit of fruitiness and some sharp herbal hops. Bit of minerally finish. Body verges on medium. Decent.

473 ml can from The Beer Store. Pours a clear ruby/copper colour with modest-sized off-white head. Aroma is caramel and a very light grassiness. Flavour is caramel, a little graininess and a very light grassiness. Watery mouthfeel and flavour. Not totally terrible, just really mediocre.

473 ml can from The Beer Store. Pours a clear orange colour with modest-sized white head. Aroma is floral hops, a bit of sweet citrus and some cereal grains. Flavour is pleasant though not overly assertive floral hops with a bit of orange zest and some mild cereal grains. Carbonation a little more pronounced than expected. Pleasant.

Growler from Summerhill LCBO. Pours a lightly cloudy golden orange with white head with some lace. Aroma is fruity Belgian yeast, citrus hops and a bit of spice. Flavour is fairly Belgian too with a solid citrus hop note and other tropical fruit plus spice. Average plus body. Good one.

650 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy golden colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is sour fruit, fair amount of spice, grains and a bit of a herbal note. Flavour is lemon zest, tart apple, some Brett type character, pepper, clove, bread and some herbal/resiny character. Drying finish. Nice.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear copper colour with modest-sized off-white head. Aroma is toasted grains, caramel and some fruitiness. Flavour has lots of caramel, toasty bread, solid fruity note and little mineraliness. Slick mouthfeel.

473 ml can from LCBO. Pours a hazy golden colour with average white head. Aroma is wheat, bit of fruitiness and a light grassiness. Flavour has chewy wheat, fruit with a bit of spice and grass. Mellower carbonation. Pleasant.

341 ml bottle from brewery. Pours an orangey dark brown with small light tan head. Aroma is fairly roasty with some graininess and resiny hops. Flavour is roasty, verging on smoky, with a decent resiny hoppiness and a moderately bitter finish. Carbonation on the livelier sider. Good one.
beer_name: Barley Days Ursa Major Black IPA

review_blob: 650 ml bottle from brewery. Pours a murky amber brown with modest-sized eggshell-coloured head. Aroma is caramel, lots of nuttiness and a bit of toasty graininess. Flavour has caramel sweetness that is balanced by toast and a solid nuttiness. Slick mouthfeel. Solid one.
beer_name: Northumberland Hills 6 Miles from  Bangor Irish Red

review_blob: 341 ml bottle from brewery. Pours an orange-tinged dark brown with modest-sized cream-coloured head. Aroma is roasted malt, dark fruit, coffee and nuts. Flavour is on the sweet side, but with modest roastiness and notes of tartish cherry, coffee and nuts. A little sticky in the mouthfeel. Decent.
beer_name: Barley Days Ursa Minor Black Lager

review_blob: 650 ml bottle from brewery. Pours a very dark brown with modest-sized light tan head. Aroma is dry and roasty with chocolate and a little coffee and nuttiness. Flavour is also fairly roasty and dry with a dry cocoa note and subtler coffee and nuts. Drying finish. Nothing crazy but an enjoyable dry stout.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a cloudy orange colour with smallish white head. Aroma is mellow tangerine and lime with some caramel and grainy character. Flavour is soapy tropical/citrus fruit, sweetish caramel and some graininess. Easy drinking, but interesting enough.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a murky red-tinged brown with modest-sized eggshell-coloured head. Aroma is roasty and nutty with notes of chocolate and graininess. Flavour is modestly roasty with definite nuttiness and a bit of chocolate sweetness. Average body. Nice.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a murky caramel colour with moderate-sized cream-coloured head. Aroma is toffee, herbal bitterness and a bit of toastiness. Flavour has toasted grains, toffee and mellow herbal hops. Average plus body. Solid.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear golden orange colour with solid white head. Aroma is grainy with a little fruity sweetness and some mellow grassiness. Flavour is grainy with a more pronounced sweetness and modest grassy hops. Fine carbonation. Not super complex but pleasant.

650 ml bottle from the brewery. Pours an ultra dark brown colour with moderate-sized, lasting mocha-coloured head. Aroma is fairly sweet with chocolate and molasses, relatively muted roastiness and some nuts. Flavour is big on chocolate and molasses with some dark fruit, roastiness and nuttiness. Silky mouthfeel. Agree that I would have expected more body for the ABV, though by no means thin in absolute terms. All in all a nice one.

650 ml bottle from brewery. Pours a nearly clear golden colour with average-sized white head. Aroma is biscuity malt and a bit of grassy, earthy hoppiness. Flavour is full of cereal maltiness with a mellow grassy/earthy hop character. Just a little crispness in finish. Pleasant.
beer_name: Northumberland Hills PS I Love You

review_blob: 650 ml bottle from brewery. Pours a clear golden colour with small white head. Aroma is on the gentler side with some breadiness and a hint of straw. Flavour has a slightly coarse breadiness with straw and an impression of lemon. Average body. Accessible, but not particularly exciting.
beer_name: Northumberland Hills Cooler by the Lake

review_blob: On tap at Bar Hop Brew Co. Pours a clear golden orange with moderate-sized white head with nice lacing. Aroma is big resiny and citric hops with solid caramel backbone. Flavour is also big, but not overly bitter, pine resin and citrusy hops with lots of caramel and a little graininess providing the balance. Plus body. Not a brewery Im terribly familiar with, but colour me impressed.

On tap at Bar Hop Brew Co. Pours a murky dull golden yellow with modest-sized white head. Aroma bursts with juicy tropical fruit, lots of Brett and some graininess. Flavour pops with pineapple, lychee and grapefruit with lots of Brett character and an underlying graininess. Carbonation on the gentler side. Really nice.
beer_name: Great Lakes Brewing x Bar Hop Someone Elses Problem

review_blob: On tap at Bar Hop Brew Co. Pours a clear golden orange with moderate-sized white head with good retention. Aroma is on the mellower side with some sweet fruit, Belgian yeast spiciness and some citrusy hops. Flavour is a little punchier with some fruity esters, spice and citrusy hops. Average body. Decent.

On tap at Bar Hop Brew Co. Pours a clear golden colour with average white head. Aroma is grainy with some lemon zest and honey. Flavour is honeyed bread with some lemon zest and a little pepperiness. Average body and carbonation. Solid hopped up lager.

On tap at Bar Hop. Pours a lightly cloudy orangey-brown with small off-white head. Aroma is sour cherry, caramel, other fruit and lots of spiciness. Flavour is big on sour cherry, crabapple, toffee and spice. Mellower carbonation. Pretty nice.

On tap at Bar Hop. Pours a copper brown with an average-sized off-white head. Aroma is sweet candy sugar, dark fruit, grains and spice. Flavour really pops with sweet dark fruit especially cherry, some brown sugar, light graininess and some nice spiciness. Fine carbonation. Nice one.
beer_name: Great Lakes Brewing X Bar Hop Come Uppance

review_blob: On tap at Bar Hop. Pours a rubyish brown colour with good-sized creamy light tan head. Aroma is big vanilla, nuts, toasted malt and some fruitiness. Flavour is also vanilla forward with a mellow toastiness, some tree fruit and an underlying nuttiness. Slightly creamy mouthfeel. Nice.
